data.text:
In Jeff Bezos: Other activities

…Bezos founded a spaceflight company, Blue Origin, in 2000. Blue Origin bought a launch site in Texas soon thereafter and planned to introduce a crewed suborbital spacecraft, New Shepard, in 2018 and an orbital launch vehicle, New Glenn, in 2020. Bezos bought The Washington Post and affiliated publications for \$250…

Read More

In space tourism: Suborbital space tourism

In Texas, Blue Origin, a privately funded aerospace company set up by Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos, developed its New Shepard spacecraft (named for American astronaut Alan Shepard). With its bullet-shaped fuselage, New Shepard takes off and lands vertically, in contrast to the mother-ship deployment of
